1.verse: LORD, thou hast been favourable unto thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.

2.verse: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.

3.verse: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger.

4.verse: Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease.

5.verse: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations?

6.verse: Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

7.verse: Shew us thy mercy, O LORD, and grant us thy salvation.

8.verse: I will hear what God the LORD will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.

9.verse: Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.

10.verse: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

11.verse: Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

12.verse: Yea, the LORD shall give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase.

13.verse: Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set us in the way of his steps.
